comments: Contribution from _Gary W. Adamson_, Apr 17 2009: (Start)Preface the series with another "1": (1, 1, 1, 3, 7,...a(n)). Then a(n+2) = (1, 1, 1, 3, 7,...a(n)) dot (equal number of terms in (1, 2, 4, 8,...)).Example: (143) = (1, 1, 1, 3, 7) dot (1, 2, 4, 8, 16) = (1 + 2 + 4 + 24 + 112).Analogous procedures apply to other q-Fibonacci sequences for q(n). (End)
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[0]==0, a[1]==1, a[n]==a[n-1]+a[n-2]*2^(n-2)}, a, {n, 20}] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 08 2012 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [0] cat [n le 2 select 1 else Self(n-1) + Self(n-2)*(2^(n-2)): n in [1..20]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 08 2012(Sage) from ore_algebra import *; R.<x> = QQ['x']; A.<Qx> = OreAlgebra(R, 'Qx', q=2); print (Qx^2 - Qx - x).to_list([0,1], 10)  # _Ralf Stephan_, Apr 24 2014
